meanings.definition: The quality or state of being late or tardy.
meanings.sent1: Her unpunctuality caused her to miss the bus every morning.
meanings.sent2: His unpunctuality at work led to warnings from his boss.
meanings.sent3: The unpunctuality of the sleepy sloth made the other animals chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The unpunctuality of the train was like a slow-moving turtle on the tracks.
meanings.sent5: The unpunctuality of the student was as noticeable as a bright red apple in a sea of green.

meanings.definition: The habit or practice of being consistently late.
meanings.sent1: Despite reminders, his unpunctuality persisted in all his appointments.
meanings.sent2: Her unpunctuality became a topic of discussion among her friends.
meanings.sent3: The unpunctuality of the rabbit in arriving at the tea party amused the other animals.
meanings.sent4: The unpunctuality of the clouds in bringing rain mirrored his delays.
meanings.sent5: The unpunctuality of the old clock made time feel like a slow river flowing backward.
